hanzi-su-wiki:
偽

Значения

Лгать, обманывать

Мнемоника

Раб 亻 как и дрессированная самка обезьяны 為, склонен к хитрости и обману.

Варианты

伪
purpleculture_pinyin:
wěi
false; fake; forged; bogus; (prefix) pseudo-; Taiwan pr. [wei4]
ложный; не настоящие; кованые; фальшивка; (префикс) псевдо-; Тайвань пр. [wei4]
rtega_mnemonic:
偽偽RS
伪伪		false, counterfeit, bogus
  • person 亻 feeling if this elephant 為/为 is false
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 伪)
Synonym: 假
Antonyms: 真
Pictophonetic: 為 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
偽造 [ wěi zào ]: to forge; to fake; to counterfeit
偽軍 [ wěi jūn ]: puppet army
偽裝 [ wěi zhuāng ]: to pretend to be (asleep etc); to disguise oneself as; pretense; disguise; (military) to camouflage; camouflage
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 為 [ wèi ] to do, to act; to handle, to govern; to be
heisig_chinese_memo: Mr. T doesn’t act bogus. It goes against everything he stands for. “I pity da foos who revel in falsehoods!”.
heisig_constituent: falsehood, person, do, so, strange building, tail feathers
Keyword_KANJIDIC: falsehood, lie, deceive, pretend, counterfeit, forgery
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: ложь, ложь, обманывать, вид, поддельные, подделки
koohiiStory1: A person who claims he didn't do something while he actually did, is telling a falsehood.
koohiiStory2: It depends on what your definition of do, uh, is, says Mr. T giving falsehood about his affair with a peacock.
kunYomi: いつわ.る、にせ、いつわ.り
jp_example_words: 偽造(ぎぞう): forgery, falsification, fabrication, counterfeiting
jp_readingExamples: 偽る (いつわ.る), 偽 (にせ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The leader gets a nice uniform for the sake of not wanting to look like a fake. The leader is a fake, he just doesn’t want to look like one. He’s not really a leader, but he thinks he should get an official-looking uniform for the sake of not looking like a fake.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Look at this fake leader. See him scramble into a uniform. Does he look like a real leader? Or can you tell that he is a fake?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Well, everyone found out he was a fake anyway, and now you're all going to use a guillotine (ぎ) to cut off his fake head.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Watch as the guillotine comes down. You close your eyes for a second, and when you open them you see that the leader's body was a fake! Wait, where did he go?!
Ru_Meaning: falsehood, lie, deceive, pretend, counterfeit, forgery
Ru_trainchinese: wěi: (графема) ложный, фальшивый, поддельный; незаконный, марионеточный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: what does a man (亻) do (為)? He lies ...
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Mr. T does not do bogus people.  He'll quickly dismiss you if there is any falsehood in your voice.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " people " to " for ". The original meaning is artificial. Xu Kai's "Shuowen Jiezi Biography": "A person who is hypocritical, man does it, not naive, so it is hypocrisy by literati." Man is the opposite of nature and nature. "Xunzi. "Evil of Nature" "Human nature is evil, and the good ones are false." Yang Jie's note: "False is also true. Anything that is not nature but human acts is called false. Therefore, it means that the word is the same and the word is understood. Also." "Lun Heng. "Nature": "The hypocrites, when they grow up, they are forced to do good.

" False " means fraud and dishonesty. "Said Wen": "Fake, fraud." Paragraph note: "Fraud, deceive. "Exegesis" says: "Fraud, fake." Such as "Zhou Li. Local official Situ. "Xu Shi": "Check for fraud, ornaments, and punish people, and punish them." "Huainanzi. "Qi Zhen" "the virtuous person acts hypocrisy", Gao Luo's note: "false, not sincere." It is extended to pretend, pretend, such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-Eighth Year of Xi Gong": "The branch made Yu drag the firewood to hide the falsehood. The Chu master rushed to it, and Yuan Zhen, but Qing slammed it with the Chinese army official." "The Family of Prime Minister Chen": "The Empress Dowager Lu made all Lu as king, and Chen Ping pretended to listen to it."

" False " also means false, as opposed to " true ". Such as "Zhuangzi. "Qiwulun": "Dao evil is hidden but true or false? Evil is hidden but right and wrong?" "Three Kingdoms. Shu Shu. But the True Story: "Investigate the authenticity of ancient and modern times, the gains and losses of timekeeping."

" Is ", " pseudo " ancient books connected. Duan Yucai's note in "Said Wen": "Many false scriptures are false." Such as "Poetry. Wang Feng. humanum_short_description_en: From " people " to " for ". The original meaning is artificial.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，從「為」。本義是人為。徐鍇《說文解字繫傳》：「偽者，人為之也，非天真也，故於文人為為偽。」人為與天生、天性相對。《荀子．性惡》「人之性惡，其善者偽也」，楊倞注：「偽，為也。凡非天性而人作為之者，皆謂之偽。故為字人傍為，亦會意字也。」《論衡．本性》：「偽者，長大之後，勉使為善也。」

　　「偽」表示欺詐、不誠實。《說文》：「偽，詐也。」段注：「詐者，欺也。《釋詁》曰：『詐，偽也。』」如《周禮．地官司徒．胥師》：「察其詐偽、飾行、儥慝者，而誅罰之。」《淮南子．俶真》「德蕩者其行偽」，高誘注：「偽，不誠也。」引申為偽裝、假裝，如《左傳．僖公二十八年》：「枝使輿曳柴而偽遁，楚師馳之，原軫、郤溱以中軍公族橫擊之。」《史記．陳丞相世家》：「呂太后立諸呂為王，陳平偽聽之。」

　　「偽」也表示虛假，與「真」相對。如《莊子．齊物論》：「道惡乎隱而有真偽？言惡乎隱而有是非？」《三國志．蜀書．郤正傳》：「究古今之真偽，計時務之得失。」

　　「為」、「偽」古書相通。《說文》段玉裁注：「經傳多假為為偽。」如《詩．王風．兔爰》「我生之初，尚無為」，陳奐傳疏：「為即偽也，凡成於人為謂之偽。」「偽」的人為義、詐偽義和作假義都是指一般作為的「為」的引申義，故古書中有時就用「為」來表示。出土文獻《郭店簡．老子甲》簡1「絕[為心]（為）棄慮」，「[為心]」在此表示人為，釋讀為「為」或「偽」都是可以的。（裘錫圭）
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
偽 (Simplified: 伪)
Pinyin: wěi
English Definition: false; fake; forged; bogus; (prefix) pseudo-; Taiwan pr. [wei4]
Synonym: 假
Antonyms: 真
Total strokes: 11; Radical: 人
Pictophonetic: 為 indicates the sound; 亻 (person) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 為 [ wèi ] to do, to act; to handle, to govern; to be
Example Words:
偽造 [ wěi zào ]: to forge; to fake; to counterfeit
偽軍 [ wěi jūn ]: puppet army
偽裝 [ wěi zhuāng ]: to pretend to be (asleep etc); to disguise oneself as; pretense; disguise; (military) to camouflage; camouflage
More: 偽* | *偽 | *偽*

從「 人 」，從「 為 」。本義是人為。徐鍇《說文解字繫傳》：「偽者，人為之也，非天真也，故於文人為為偽。」人為與天生、天性相對。《荀子．性惡》「人之性惡，其善者偽也」，楊倞注：「偽，為也。凡非天性而人作為之者，皆謂之偽。故為字人傍為，亦會意字也。」《論衡．本性》：「偽者，長大之後，勉使為善也。」 「 偽 」表示欺詐、不誠實。《說文》：「偽，詐也。」段注：「詐者，欺也。《釋詁》曰：『詐，偽也。』」如《周禮．地官司徒．胥師》：「察其詐偽、飾行、儥慝者，而誅罰之。」《淮南子．俶真》「德蕩者其行偽」，高誘注：「偽，不誠也。」引申為偽裝、假裝，如《左傳．僖公二十八年》：「枝使輿曳柴而偽遁，楚師馳之，原軫、郤溱以中軍公族橫擊之。」《史記．陳丞相世家》：「呂太后立諸呂為王，陳平偽聽之。」 「 偽 」也表示虛假，與「 真 」相對。如《莊子．齊物論》：「道惡乎隱而有真偽？言惡乎隱而有是非？」《三國志．蜀書．郤正傳》：「究古今之真偽，計時務之得失。」 「 為 」、「 偽 」古書相通。《說文》段玉裁注：「經傳多假為為偽。」如《詩．王風．兔爰》「我生之初，尚無為」，陳奐傳疏：「為即偽也，凡成於人為謂之偽。」「 偽 」的人為義、詐偽義和作假義都是指一般作為的「 為 」的引申義，故古書中有時就用「 為 」來表示。出土文獻《郭店簡．老子甲》簡1「絕[為心]（為）棄慮」，「[為心]」在此表示人為，釋讀為「 為 」或「 偽 」都是可以的。（裘錫圭）

偽字的基本解释

偽
wěi
见“伪”。

偽字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wěi］
［《廣韻》危睡切，去寘，疑。］
亦作“偽1”。“伪1”的繁体字。
(1)人为。
(2)奸伪；欺诈。
(3)伪装；假装。
(4)虚伪；虚假。
(5)僭伪。指非法的政权。
(6)通“帷”。
(7)通“爲”（wéi）。实行。
(8)通“爲”（wèi）。替。
[②]［é］
［《集韻》吾禾切，平戈，疑。］
亦作“偽2”。“伪2”的繁体字。
(1)通“訛”。改变；变化。
(2)通“訛”。错误；差错。参见“僞2謬”。
(3)通“吪”。动。
[③]［guì］
［《集韻》居僞切，去寘，見。］
亦作“偽3”。“伪3”的繁体字。
钱币。

偽字的康熙字典解释

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
偽字的起名意思

暂无。

False
Basic explanation of words
False
wěi
See "pseudo".
False
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wěi］
["Guangyun" sleeps in danger, go to question, doubt. ]
Also known as "pseudo 1". "False 1" in traditional characters.
(1) Artificial.
(2) Fake; fraud.
(3) Disguise; pretend.
(4) Hypocrisy; false.
(5) Falsehood. Refers to an illegal regime.
(6) Through "curtain".
(7) Tong "为" (wéi). Implement.
(8) Through "为" (wèi). for.
[②] [é]
["Ji Yun" Wu He cut, Ping Ge, doubt. ]
Also known as "pseudo 2". "False 2" in traditional characters.
(1) Through "corruption". Change; change.
(2) Through "corrupt". Error; error. See "Pseudo 2 Fallacy".
(3) Through "吪". move.
[③]［guì］
["Jiyun" is a pseudo-cut, go and set, see. ]
Also known as "pseudo-3". "False 3" in traditional characters.
coin.
False

Name meaning

wěi, wéi, é, guì
вм. 伪
Radicals: ｲ, 為  (leader, sake)
Meaning Mnemonic
The leader gets a nice uniform for the sake of not wanting to look like a fake. The leader is a fake, he just doesn’t want to look like one. He’s not really a leader, but he thinks he should get an official-looking uniform for the sake of not looking like a fake.
Look at this fake leader. See him scramble into a uniform. Does he look like a real leader? Or can you tell that he is a fake?
Reading Mnemonic
Well, everyone found out he was a fake anyway, and now you're all going to use a guillotine (ぎ) to cut off his fake head.
Watch as the guillotine comes down. You close your eyes for a second, and when you open them you see that the leader's body was a fake! Wait, where did he go?!
